subject: Re: I'm a new member/Lyn
author: angels4lyn
full_text:
well, what goes on here is not like a poltergiest. at least not to me.
no pranks, nothing like that.

its just like something lives here to, and occasionally it wants someone's
attention.
it calls our names, most of the time it occurs in only the bedroom areas,
but a few times voices were heard in another room.
when one person hears their name called...no one else can hear it. just
them.
but every member of this household has heard their named called.

many times they call my cats, or my cats will sit and stare at something,
watch it move, follow it etc. when no one  or no thing is there.

what ever it is, it always seems to be 5-6 ft off the floor..like they are
looking at a person maybe.

I dont think its anything bad.. but I do get spooked...weird things have
happened to me since asge 6..and it just spooks me at times.

but we've watched books get picked up off bookcase shelves, stand straight
up, fan open, and then drop to the floor.. my son a nd I watched that with
really huge eyes !!!
I watched something grab a chair cushion and yank on it, it was not the type
easy to move, so it yanked again, and I screamed for my daughter to come
see.. and when she got in the room it yanked it down one more time. we've
had the chair 20 yrs.. and its never done that before.  the cushions do not
fall on their own as they are wedged in, but you could see the fabric
wrinkle as it was being yanked down.

and then we have this freestanding fireplace, and the base has some white
rocks in it.
and one evening daughter and I were watching tv, and 'something' kicked the
stones right next to where she was sitting, it scared her, and the rocks
went flying about 1 foot away,. all of the cats heard it and came running
down the hall to see what happened.  they were not in the room at the time.
nothing was there when this happened.
so we have no clue how it happened.

we have doors that close or doors that open at the oddest times.

the bedrooms are on one end of the house.
and my bedroom is right across from the kids rooms.
one morning (when my kids were still at home /in high school )about 7am, I
woke up and saw my son's door opening very very slowly. I thought he was
doing it and was trying to be quiet. so I sat and watched it so I could
catch him.
and when it finally opened... he was still sleeping in his bed across that
room.
that spooked me.because it was slow and would sometimes stop...and its done
that a few times ,.night, day, when I am home alone or when others are here.
my daughter now has that room, and it does it now.
I have one door in room next to that ,  one day I left that room with the
door open as usual , to drive my daughter to work, came home and saw this
door closed. I got chills. spooked me..thought some one got ion to the house
. then I thought oh its one of the cats, they closed themselves in... and
then my 3 cats came down the hall to see me since I just got home. and thats
when I realized they were not in there.
then I thought oh sheez, someone is in this house..... but when I opened the
door.
all was well. no one was there.
I have no idea how it closed itself while I was gone, as I dont close it.
have no reason to.
but it was  closed then. and it was not the cats.

for years I blamed my kids, and cats on many of the things , that now happen
when I am alone.  but all this has gone on for 10 yrs.
but luckily it doesnt feel bad.  but it does still spook me.

now if you want to know about an evil house... go into the Glen.
I had to seek out a Curandero.....that was an 'evil' house, it scared me so
bad I went to this cuerandero...for my own safety, we needed help ...then I
packed and left, and we later moved our belongings out. never to look back.
it was pure evil. and probably still is today. that was 6 months of fear...I
am very sensitive to places, and for some reason...that one scared me
terribly and I couldnt stay there anymore. the land lady said she had a hard
time keeping it rented.

this house, I dont feel anything bad.. but something is going on. and its
off and on over the 10 yrs. no pattern that I can tell. never know when the
house will be calm and quite or when it will be active.  it just comes and
goes.
for years tho, we only heard things, but in the past 2 yrs we've begun to
see these weird things happen. so its getting physical now.
my kids are grown, my daughter moved back home to attend nursing school.
my son is over seas right now, army duty... but each one of us has seen ,
heard or experienced things in this house. including the cats  but they are
not talking ..LOL
but it doesnt seem to fit poltergiest. at least I dont think so.
nothing harmful, but we have been touched a time or two. just spooky.
Lyn

> Hello, Lyn.
>
> Have you ever read anything on poltergeists?
>
> One of the most common signs of a poltergeist "visit" (if you will)
> is the movement of objects. Less common but still a sign of a
> possible poltergeist is a disembodied voice or voices.
>
> Now - I'm not saying you have a poltergeist "visitation" (in fact -
> another common sign is that the phenomenon is short-lived...a few
> months...not an extended length of time like yours) but if you do -
> you'll find that the phenomenon takes on the personality of a
> trickster/practical joker. Due to this "personality" - it becomes
> difficult, even impossible to "catch" anything using sound recorders,
> still cameras, video, etc. As if "it" or "they" don't want evidence
> of "their" existence just to frustrate/annoy the people
> being "visited".
>
> One of the most popular theories concerning poltergeists is
> that "they" are not really spirits but the outward manifestation of
> frustration/anger/confusion of a real person (possibly even more than
> one) in the house...known as the "agent". The agent is creating the
> phenomena subconsciously using psychokinesis (commonly called "mind
> over matter") so the theory is called RSPK for Recurrent Spontaneous
> PsychoKinesis.
>
> Do you have at least one adolescent in the house who is undergoing
> puberty?
>
> One of the most famous poltergeist cases involving nearly every known
> sign of poltergeist activity such as moving objects AND voices was
> the Enfield Poltergeist case back in the late '70s. You might be
> fascinated to read up on the case at this web site:
>
> http://www.zurichmansion.org/ghosts/poltergeist.htm
>
> In the meantime - as long as no one gets hurt and your household is
> not totally disrupted by this...I'd say just accept it and go on with
> your lives.
>
> Hope that helps you somewhat.
>
> Guy
>
>
